Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does the applicant meet the tri-partite test for a stay of removal?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa, had negative refugee claim and PRRA decision, sought stay of removal
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant with pending applications
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Overstayed visa, failed to comply with immigration conditions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Pending spousal sponsorship and fear of harm in Venezuela
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Public interest in enforcing removal orders
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Request for stay of removal reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness and legal correctness as applicable
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No clear evidence provided to support irreparable harm
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Refugee claim decision, PRRA outcome, lack of medical or country condition evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 165 of IRPA (enforcement of removal orders)
Crimes.Application_Basis: Alleged risk upon return and ongoing immigration applications
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of concrete evidence of irreparable harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa and had multiple negative immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Claims assessed as speculative and unsupported
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA Section 183 (duty to leave after status expires)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient proof of risk or exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant with residency and status obligations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility due to lack of substantiation
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Failure to meet any branch of the tri-partite test
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Tri-partite test for stay of removal

Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court found evidence insufficient to establish risk
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA Sections related to compliance with conditions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of objective evidence supporting harm claims

Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient to meet burden of proof
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Balance of convenience favors Minister; public interest paramount
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Generalized country conditions not tied to personal risk

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with court order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicant meets tri-partite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate all three branches of tri-partite test
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Stay requires serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and appropriateness of stay request
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Pending applications and fear of harm
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No success on merits of stay application
Crimes.Review_Standard: Correctness for legal questions, reasonableness for discretion

Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA and case law on stays
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Seeking to prevent removal despite final orders

Crimes.Defendant_Response: Minister argued public interest in enforcement
